definition: to seek an audience with higher-ups (esp. government officials) to petition for sth
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

sentences.english: I say 99 percent of repeat petitioners are mentally ill.
sentences.chinese: 我敢說99%的上訪專業戶精神有問題。

sentences.english: Xu told the protestors that the relocation was still in the planning stages.
sentences.chinese: 徐省長告訴上訪者說該搬遷方案尚在計劃階段。

sentences.english: Beijing suburb farmers' appealing to the higher authorities for help focus losing land problems.
sentences.chinese: 失地問題已成爲京郊農民上訪的主流。

sentences.english: The most dogged petitioners are often classified as crazy.
sentences.chinese: 大部分上訪釘子戶都是精神病。

sentences.english: The petitioning system has long provided an outlet for rural grievances.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來，上訪制度爲農村積怨提供了一個出口。

sentences.english: It was in the street, he accidentally received a petition to Beijing to complain to the case.
sentences.chinese: 那是他在街上無意中受理的一個進京上訪告狀案。

sentences.english: Fellow petitioners collect their body parts and call for the ouster of the Communist Party.
sentences.chinese: 同是上訪的人蒐集了兩位的殘肢，喊着政黨下臺。

definition: to harbor/to shelter
armed confrontation/bust-up between gangs
to smash
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to harbor hard feelings
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
Xihua county in Zhoukou 周口[Zhou1 kou3], Henan
to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to tie up/to bind/to tether/bondage (BDSM)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
to demand repayment
to resign a government post
impoverished/backward both economically and culturally
to form a clique
